result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • John C Duncan was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • John C Duncan was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

02:34pm. Defendant John C Duncan in court, in custody with attorney Alexander J. Kostal.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Brenda Preston on the phone.  All parties have received the revocation and order.  Argument by Atty Lippert.  Argument by Atty Kostal. Statement by Mr. Duncan.  Court will impose 2 years initial confinement in the WI State prison and 3 years extended supervision.  Consecutive to any other sentence.  Eligible for substance abuse programand Challenge Incarceration program. 455  days jail credit. Fines/cost converted to a civil judgment. 2:55pm.

Request to appear by phone filed by Agent Brenda Preston.

APPROVED.
Appointed Attorney Kostal
